Description: Prosecution of Carmet Ltd. after an employee was fatally injured when struck by a 31 foot steel post. An employee and four other workers of Carmet Marine Limited had been adapting or “regulating” the bogie which is used to land and launch vessels on/off the company’s slipway by the River Mersey. One of the steel side posts of the bogie that weighed approximately 1800kg, fell and struck the employee on the back of the head resulting in his death. HSE investigation found that the steel side post had been secured to the crossbeam on the bogie by only two slackened bolts and was not supported by a crane or other means at the time of the incident. Carmet Marine Limited failed to carry out a suitable and sufficient risk assessment and implement a safe system of work.
Offence Date: This case did result from the investigation of a fatality
